tournament.name: Dan Pyre's Cockatrice Duel Commander Tournament #2

decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to control the game through a variety of powerful spells and card draw. It includes a plethora of counterspells, card draw spells, and extra turn effects to ensure that the player can control the tempo of the game and out-value their opponent. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with cards like High Tide and Candelabra of Tawnos, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a turn or ramp into high-cost spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The goal is to outmaneuver the opponent with efficient spells and card advantage while keeping the board under control.

The main idea of this Control Narset, Enlightened Master deck is to use Narset's ability to cast powerful spells for free from the top of the library while controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck is built around a strong mana base to support Narset's three colors and includes a variety of versatile spells such as counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, removal like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, and card draw like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise. By controlling the board with removal and countering threats, the deck aims to protect Narset while setting up powerful spells to close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to use Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to control the game through a variety of powerful blue spells. The deck focuses on card advantage, countering opponent's spells, and manipulating the board with various bounce effects. It aims to outvalue the opponent by drawing cards with cards like Fact or Fiction and Dig Through Time, countering threats with Force of Will and Cryptic Command, and generating extra mana with High Tide and artifacts like Chrome Mox. The deck also includes extra turn effects like Time Warp and Temporal Manipulation to gain tempo advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and win through incremental advantage and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combination of powerful tutors, reanimation spells, and efficient removal to assemble combos and control the battlefield in order to win the game. By using Sidisi, Undead Vizier as the commander, the deck is able to consistently search for key pieces and combo off with cards like Necrotic Ooze and Phyrexian Devourer combo or reanimating big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand. The deck also includes a variety of disruption spells to control the opponent's resources and interaction to protect its own game plan. Overall, the goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to execute game-winning combos while controlling the board and opponents' resources.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo potential of Animar, Soul of Elements to quickly ramp up mana and cast multiple creatures in a single turn. By reducing the cost of creature spells, Animar allows for explosive plays and efficient combos. The deck includes a variety of creatures with enters-the-battlefield effects, mana dorks, and combo pieces like Birthing Pod and Cloudstone Curio to generate value and advantage. With access to powerful tutors like Green Sun's Zenith and Survival of the Fittest, the deck can assemble key combo pieces quickly, establishing a dominant board presence. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, synergistic combo strategy that can quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on control and board manipulation, using a wide variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board advantage. With a mix of permission spells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, the goal is to control the game and eventually win through incremental advantage or a big finisher. The deck also includes a variety of lands that can help fix mana, disrupt the opponent's mana base, and provide additional utility to further enhance its control strategy. The key concept is to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent, gradually grinding them down until victory is assured.

The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage and eventually winning with powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Jace, the Mind Sculptor. With a toolbox of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. Vendilion Clique serves as both a disruptive creature and a way to dig deeper into the deck. The deck also includes combo elements like Proteus Staff and Polymorph to cheat out big threats. Overall, the key concept is to control the game through disruption and card advantage, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and disruption while utilizing the commander, Wydwen, the Biting Gale, for additional control and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its own threats, and find ways to win through incremental advantage. It includes a variety of powerful control cards like Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Liliana of the Veil, along with flexible removal options such as Toxic Deluge and Vendetta. The deck also has a strong creature package with cards like Gilded Drake and Vendilion Clique to provide additional threats and disruption. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and outmaneuvering the opponent to secure victory.
